newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina to present justice reform bill - paper.
newsitem.headline: Argentina to present justice reform bill - paper.

text.p: The Argentine government will send a bill to Congress this month to reform the overburdened, much criticized judicial system, Justice Minister Raul Granillo Ocampo said in a newspaper interview published Monday.

"In the last week of this month will be launched a judicial reform, which will be based on fortifying judicial independence...and making the justice system more accessible," Granilllo Ocampo told the Matutino Uno newspaper.
He added that the bill will also include changes to education for judges.
Argentina's courts have been heavily criticized by politicians and international organizations for suspicions of corruption and political manipulation.
Granillo Ocampo said the reform would also try and reduce the number of court cases, which he said were overburdening the system.
